snippet: The investigation is the latest in a widening series into G.M.’s handling of faulty ignition switches in its Chevrolet Cobalt sedan and other cars that the company says are linked to 31 accidents and 13 deaths.
abstract: Justice Dept has begun a criminal investigation into General Motors' decade-long failure to address deadly safety problems with faulty ignition switches before announcing a huge vehicle recall in February; preliminary inquiry is focused on whether GM failed to comply with laws requiring timely disclosure of vehicle defects.

byline.original: By BILL VLASIC and BEN PROTESS

lead_paragraph: The investigation is the latest in a widening series into G.M.’s handling of faulty ignition switches in its Chevrolet Cobalt sedan and other cars that the company says are linked to 31 accidents and 13 deaths.

headline.main: Justice Dept. Is Said to Look at G.M. Actions on Safety Flaws
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Said to Investigate G.M.’s Actions on Safety Flaws
